maria.name: Maria Tribe
maria.subheading: Forest-dwelling tribe known for strong community life and traditional dances
maria.description:
About the Maria Tribe

• Lives mainly in the forest regions of Abujmarh, Bastar
• Known for strong community life and simple living
• Deeply connected to nature and forest resources

Daily Life
• Farming, hunting, fishing, and forest produce collection
• Houses made from mud, wood, and thatched roofs
• Community decisions are taken together

Culture & Traditions
• Famous for the Bison Horn Dance
• Traditional drums and folk music
• Festivals celebrated with rituals and group dances

Food Habits
• Rice as staple food
• Chapda (red ant chutney)
• Mahua flowers and forest vegetables

sections.title: Daily Life
sections.details:
The daily life of the Maria tribe is deeply connected to the forest, with **farming** and **gathering** being central activities.

• Farming and forest produce collection
• Hunting and fishing
• Mud and thatched houses

sections.title: Food Habits
sections.details:
Their diet consists mainly of **rice**, **millets**, and naturally available forest produce.

• sukha_sag

sections.title: Dance & Music
sections.details:
Music and dance, especially the **Bison Horn Dance**, are integral to their cultural expression.

• Bison Horn Dance
• Traditional drums and folk songs

gond.name: Gond Tribe
gond.subheading: One of India’s largest tribes famous for art and nature worship
gond.description:
About the Gond Tribe

• One of the largest tribal communities in India
• Found across Bastar and southern Chhattisgarh
• Rich history of art, folklore, and traditions

Beliefs & Lifestyle
• Worship nature, trees, animals, rivers, and hills
• Farming and forest collection are main occupations
• Art is an important part of daily life

Art & Culture
• Famous for Gond paintings using dots and lines
• Paintings show animals, trees, and village life
• Folk songs are sung during festivals and farming

Festivals & Food
• Madai, Hareli, and Polam Pandum festivals
• Rice, mahua, forest fruits, and vegetables

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The **Gond tribe** is one of the largest and most historically significant tribal groups in India.

• One of the largest tribes in India
• Rich art and folklore
• Strong belief in nature worship

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
They hold a strong belief in the **sacredness of nature**, worshipping trees, rivers, and mountains.

• Worship trees, animals, and rivers
• Nature is considered sacred
• Spiritual connection with environment

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Gond art is world-renowned for its intricate **patterns** and **vibrant colors**, depicting stories of nature.

• Gond paintings made with dots and lines
• Paintings show animals and daily life
• Art passed through generations

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Staple foods include **rice** and **mahua**, supplemented by seasonal forest fruits.

• Rice
• Mahua
• Forest fruits and vegetables

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
They celebrate various festivals like **Madai** and **Hareli** to honor their deities and the harvest.

• Madai Festival
• Hareli
• Polam Pandum

baiga.name: Baiga Tribe
baiga.subheading: Forest-dwelling tribe known as the protectors of nature
baiga.description:
About the Baiga Tribe

• Primitive tribal group of Central India
• Mostly found in Kawardha and forest regions
• Known for deep connection with forests

Beliefs & Lifestyle
• Believe forests are sacred
• Practice shifting cultivation (Bewar)
• Traditional healers using forest herbs

Art & Culture
• Tattoo art (Godna) is popular
• Folk dances during festivals

Festivals & Food
• Hareli and Madai festivals
• Eat kodo, kutki, forest roots

sections.title: About
sections.details:
Baigas are known as guardians of forests.

• Primitive tribe: Recognized as PVTG
• Forest lifestyle: Live near dense forests
• Traditional knowledge: Use forest herbs

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
Nature worship is central.

• Sacred groves: Forests are holy
• Spirit worship: Believe in forest spirits
• Ancestral rituals: Honor ancestors

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Famous for tattoo art.

• Godna tattoo: Permanent body art
• Dance forms: Performed in festivals
• Handmade tools: Use wooden tools

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Forest-based simple diet.

• Kodo
• Kutki
• Mahua
• Roots and tubers

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
Celebrate seasonal festivals.

• Hareli
• Madai
• Navakhai

halba.name: Halba Tribe
halba.subheading: Agricultural tribe known for discipline and farming skills
halba.description:
• Found in Bastar region
• Primarily farmers
• Known for strong social organization

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The **Halba tribe** is one of the most progressive and landed tribal communities, often serving as landlords and holding high social status.

• Progressive Farmers: Advanced agricultural techniques
• Kabirpanthi Influence: Many follow the non-violent Kabir Panth
• Social Status: Historically held high administrative posts

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
While they worship Danteshwari Ma, a significant section follows **Kabir Panth**, abstaining from alcohol and meat.

• Danteshwari Worship: Revere the goddess of Bastar
• Kabir Panth: Sect focusing on truth and simplicity
• Ancestor Reverence: Deep respect for forefathers

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Known for their unique **Halbi dialect**, which serves as the lingua franca of Bastar, and agricultural tools craftsmanship.

• Halbi Language: The trade language of Bastar
• Agricultural Implements: Skillful making of farming tools
• Weaving: Traditional cloth weaving

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Their cuisine is famous for **Poha** (flattened rice) and **Cheela**, often prepared with special variations.

• Special Poha (Flattened rice)
• Cheela (Rice pancakes)
• Bore Baasi
• Muthia

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
Major celebrations include **Hareli**, **Pola**, and **Diwali**, celebrated with agricultural significance.

• Hareli (Farm tool worship)
• Pola (Bullock worship)
• Cherchera

bhatra.name: Bhatra Tribe
bhatra.description:
• Found in Bastar and Kondagaon
• Primarily farmers
• Known for simple lifestyle

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The **Bhatra tribe** is known for their unique social stratification and talent in **tribal theater**.

• Social Classes: Divided into Amnit (Higher) and San (Lower)
• Settled Cultivators: Permanent settled farming lifestyle
• Village Watchmen: Traditionally served as village guards

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
They worship **Mati Deo** (Earth God) and perform rituals for hunting and harvesting success.

• Mati Deo Worship: Reverence for the Earth God
• Bhairam Dev: Worship of the protector deity
• Shamanistic Rituals: Spiritual healing by Siraha

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Famous for **Bhatra Nat**, a traditional tribal theater form involving storytelling and acting.

• Bhatra Nat: Traditional theatrical performance
• Costume Making: Creating attire for dramas
• Wood Carving: Masks used in plays

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Their diet includes rice, millets, and delicacies like **Chapda** (red ant chutney).

• Rice and Pej
• Chapda (Red ant chutney)
• Forest Tubers
• Sulfi (Palm wine)

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
They celebrate **Bali Parab** and **Mati Tihar** with great enthusiasm.

• Bali Parab
• Mati Tihar
• Navakhani

oraon.name: Oraon Tribe
oraon.subheading: Agricultural tribe known for Karma dance and vibrant festivals
oraon.description:
• Also known as Kurukh tribe
• Found in Jashpur, Surguja and northern Chhattisgarh
• Strong community traditions and agricultural lifestyle

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The Oraon are famous for their **Dhumkuria** (Youth Dormitory) system and advanced community living.

• Dhumkuria System: Traditional youth learning center
• Plough Cultivators: Expert settled farmers
• Totemic Clans: Clans named after animals/plants

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
They follow the **Sarna** religion, worshipping nature in sacred groves, and honor **Dharmesh** (Sun God).

• Sarna Dharma: Worship in Sarnasthali (Sacred Grove)
• Dharmesh Worship: Supreme Sun Deity
• Ancestor Spirits: Burial stones for ancestors

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Renowned for their **geometric wall paintings** and the rhythmic **Karma dance**.

• Wall Paintings: Geometric mud designs
• Karma Dance: Circle dance with Karam branch
• Musical Instruments: Mandar and Nagada drums

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Staple food is rice and **Gondli**, often accompanied by **Handia** (rice beer) during festivals.

• Rice and Gondli
• Handia (Rice beer)
• Dried Mushrooms
• Rugda (Forest vegetable)

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
Major festivals are **Sarhul** (Spring) and **Karma**, celebrating nature cycles.

• Sarhul (Flower festival)
• Karma
• Phagua

binjhwar.name: Binjhwar Tribe
binjhwar.subheading: Agricultural tribal community of central Chhattisgarh
binjhwar.description:
• Found in Raigarh and surrounding districts
• Mainly farmers
• Preserve traditional customs

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The **Binjhwar** tribe claims a connection to the Vindhya hills and holds the **arrow** (Tir) as a sacred symbol.

• Vindhyavasini Lineage: Claim origin from Vindhyas
• Sacred Arrow: Arrow used in all rituals
• Freedom Struggle: Legacy of Veer Narayan Singh

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
They worship **Vindhyavasini Devi** and have unique marriage rituals where an arrow represents the groom.

• Vindhyavasini Devi: Chief deity worship
• Arrow Marriage: Ritual marriage with arrow
• Thakur Deo: Protector of the village

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Skilled in making **bamboo articles**, mats, and fishing traps from forest materials.

• Basketry: Intricate bamboo work
• Fishing Traps: Traditional fishing gear
• Jewelry: Bead and metal ornaments

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Their diet depends on rice and forest produce like **Tendu** and **Char**.

• Rice
• Forest mushrooms
• Tendu fruit
• Fish

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
They celebrate **Jwara** and **Bhojali**, involving the sprouting of wheat/barley.

• Jwara
• Bhojali
• Hareli

kanwar.name: Kanwar Tribe
kanwar.subheading: Tribal community known for farming and traditional governance
kanwar.description:
• Found in Raigarh and Korba districts
• Agriculture main occupation
• Preserve tribal customs and rituals

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The **Kanwar tribe** traces their descent from the **Kauravas** of the Mahabharata and has a martial history.

• Mahabharata Lineage: Claim descent from Kauravas
• Military Tradition: Served as soldiers (Paik)
• Clean Living: Emphasis on purity and discipline

sections.title: Beliefs
sections.details:
They strictly follow their clan rules and worship the sword as a symbol of their warrior past.

• Sword Worship: Symbol of bravery
• Dulha Deo: Worship of the bridegroom deity
• Sagai Devi: Clan goddess

sections.title: Art & Craft
sections.details:
Their artistic expression is seen in **wall paintings** during festivals and martial dance forms.

• Wall Reliefs: Mud relief work on walls
• War Dances: Dances mimicking combat
• Tattooing: Traditional Godna art

sections.title: Food
sections.details:
Staple food is rice and pulses; many have adopted vegetarianism due to reform movements.

• Rice and Urad Dal
• Vegetarian Dish
• Mahua (Religious use)

sections.title: Festivals
sections.details:
Celebrations include **Hareli** and **Laruj Kaj**, a unique pig sacrifice festival (though declining).

• Laruj Kaj
• Hareli
• Pola

korwa.name: Pahadi Korwa
korwa.subheading: Vulnerable hill tribe living traditionally with deep dependence on forests
korwa.description:
About the Pahadi Korwa Tribe

• Classified as a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group (PVTG)
• Lives in hilly and forest areas of northern Chhattisgarh
• Very limited influence of modern lifestyle

Living Style
• Depends heavily on forests for survival
• Lives in small huts made from mud and bamboo
• Collects food from deep forest areas

Traditional Skills
• Archery and hunting skills
• Making tools from forest materials
• Strong knowledge of forest paths and nature

Food Sources
• Mahua collection
• Roots, tubers, and wild fruits

sections.title: About
sections.details:
The **Pahadi Korwa** are a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group, living in harmony with the deep forests.

• Classified as PVTG
• Lives in remote forest hills
• Very limited modern influence

sections.title: Living Style
sections.details:
They live a simple life in **thatched huts**, relying entirely on the forest for their needs.

• Depends heavily on forests
• Small huts made from mud and bamboo
• Collects forest produce for survival

sections.title: Traditional Skills
sections.details:
They are expert **archers** and skilled in making tools from bamboo and wood.

• Archery and hunting
• Tool making from forest materials
• Strong forest navigation skills

sections.title: Food Sources
sections.details:
Their food sources are primarily **foraged** from the wild, including roots, tubers, and mahua.

• Mahua
• Roots and tubers
• Wild fruits
